author: Shefali Luthra
text:
Latest California Healthline Stories
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/to-insure-more-poor-children-it-helps-if-parents-are-on-medicaid/) [To Insure More Poor Children, It Helps If Parents Are On Medicaid](https://californiahealthline.org/news/to-insure-more-poor-children-it-helps-if-parents-are-on-medicaid/)
New research offers evidence that coverage expansion policies for adults have a positive spillover effect for kids.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/another-way-for-anti-vaxxers-to-skip-shots-for-school-kids-a-doctors-note/) [Another Way For Anti-Vaxxers To Skip Shots For Schoolkids: A Doctor’s Note](https://californiahealthline.org/news/another-way-for-anti-vaxxers-to-skip-shots-for-school-kids-a-doctors-note/)
No longer able to get exemptions for personal beliefs in California, parents opposed to inoculations seem to be obtaining medical exemptions for their children, according to a new study.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/st-kitts-launches-probe-of-herpes-vaccine-tests-on-u-s-patients/) [St. Kitts Launches Probe Of Herpes Vaccine Tests On U.S. Patients](https://californiahealthline.org/news/st-kitts-launches-probe-of-herpes-vaccine-tests-on-u-s-patients/)
After a Kaiser Health News report on an offshore herpes vaccine trial that skirted FDA regulations, St. Kitts and Nevis officials claim they had no knowledge of the testing. An investigation is underway.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/cancer-cuando-escribir-ayuda-a-sanar/) [Cáncer: cuando escribir ayuda a sanar](https://californiahealthline.org/news/cancer-cuando-escribir-ayuda-a-sanar/)
A través de la escritura expresiva, pacientes con cáncer logran canalizar sus miedos y ansiedades, y contar sus historias, en un inédito proceso creativo.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/despues-de-charlottesville-por-que-las-personas-se-unen-a-grupos-de-odio/) [Después de Charlottesville: por qué las personas se unen a grupos de odio](https://californiahealthline.org/news/despues-de-charlottesville-por-que-las-personas-se-unen-a-grupos-de-odio/)
Hay 917 grupos de odio conocidos en los Estados Unidos, un número que ha ido aumentando en los últimos dos años, según datos del Southern Poverty Law Center.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/kids-find-breathing-room-at-asthma-camp/) [Kids Find Breathing Room At Asthma Camp](https://californiahealthline.org/news/kids-find-breathing-room-at-asthma-camp/)
Camps teach children how to rely less on grownups and more on themselves to manage the chronic lung disease that afflicts 1 in 6 California children.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/childhood-torment-social-isolation-can-turn-minds-toward-hate/) [Charlottesville Postmortem: Why People Join Hate Groups](https://californiahealthline.org/news/childhood-torment-social-isolation-can-turn-minds-toward-hate/)
Unhappy childhood experiences can drive people to join white supremacist groups, studies have found.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/dying-at-home-in-an-opioid-crisis-hospices-grapple-with-stolen-meds/) [Dying At Home In An Opioid Crisis: Hospices Grapple With Stolen Meds](https://californiahealthline.org/news/dying-at-home-in-an-opioid-crisis-hospices-grapple-with-stolen-meds/)
As more patients receive hospice care at home, some of the powerful, addictive drugs they’re prescribed are ending up in the wrong hands.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/con-visitas-a-domicilio-ayudan-a-nuevos-padres-a-criar-hijos-mas-saludables/) [Con visitas a domicilio ayudan a nuevos padres a criar hijos más saludables](https://californiahealthline.org/news/con-visitas-a-domicilio-ayudan-a-nuevos-padres-a-criar-hijos-mas-saludables/)
A nivel nacional, un programa financiado por la Ley de Cuidado de Salud Asequible (ACA), envía trabajadores de salud a domicilio que aconsejan sobre crianza y paternidad.
[](https://californiahealthline.org/news/home-visits-help-new-parents-overcome-tough-histories-raise-healthy-children/) [Home Visits Help New Parents Overcome Tough Histories, Raise Healthy Children](https://californiahealthline.org/news/home-visits-help-new-parents-overcome-tough-histories-raise-healthy-children/)
A program that provides $400 million in federal funding for the visits expires next month. Advocates and providers hope it will be reauthorized with a higher level of funding — but some worry that might not happen.
